nameEntry.part: Society of Women Writers Western Australia Inc.
Society of Women Writers (Australia) West Australian Branch

place.placeEntry: POPO Box 434, Northbridge, WA 6865 Email: sww_wa@hotmail.com

biogHist.abstract: The Society of Women Writers Western Australia Inc. began in 1977 with five members as a Magazine Branch of the Society of Women Writers (Australia). In 1981, with a membership of approximately fifty, it became a full Branch, and it 2000 it became a an independent incorporated body when the national society was disbanded. The Society's main aim is to draw together women writers to support each other in their writing endeavours, and various seminars, worshops and other activities are organised towards this end.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Society of Women Writers Western Australia Inc.', in The Australian Women's Register, National Foundation for Australian Women and The University of Melbourne

archref.repository: National Library of Australia Manuscript Collection
archref.abstract: The collection includes the Sydney office's records, correspondence of the various state branches, constitutional details, newsletters, manuscripts from various literary competitions and workshops, publications of the Society, membership lists, accounts, applications for grants, conference papers and minutes of the Society's meetings. A large component of the collection is that concerning the Society's 1978 short story competition, for which there are many letters of application and numerous manuscripts.
